instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no blk no lcd
threads.message:
logic board repair- water spill
----------initial testing----------
no backlight no lcd, powers on, chime, fan spin, green light
------------inspection report-------------------
corroded- j4800, pad 1 J8400 competely oxidised, tpad cable, tpad conn tpad side, j8300, <CAPACITOR>C8317</CAPACITOR> pad 1 missing, <CAPACITOR>C7713</CAPACITOR>, <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> missing, <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> pad 1 and 2 missing, <CAPACITOR>C7795</CAPACITOR> missing, <CAPACITOR>C7796</CAPACITOR> pad 1 missing.
------------repair report-------------------------
J8300 replaced
wire run from J8300 pins 3/4 to <CAPACITOR>C8317</CAPACITOR> pin 1
<CAPACITOR>C7713</CAPACITOR> replaced
new <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> pin 1 attached directly to L7701 pin 2
new <CAPACITOR>C7796</CAPACITOR> pin 1 directly attached to <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> pin 2
wire run from pin 2 <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> to pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C8317</CAPACITOR>
replaced J4800
replaced tpad cable
replaced tpad
--------------previous technician damage report-----------------
tpad connector and tpad connector cable damaged by previous technician
corrosion cleaned by user eliminating clues
insertion and removal marks found on lcd connector cable

after testing everything seems to work fine, ive installed istat menus and CPU system agent core is reading 0c, does anyone know which sensor this is attached to

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no blk no lcd
threads.message: Getting an image is the first thing to be fixed. Tried a known good LCD assembly? J8300 properly soldered?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no blk no lcd
threads.message: Only the last paragraph is my question, the rest is history

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no blk no lcd
threads.message: the macbook has been returned to the customer as repaired, I just want to know what the CPU system agent core sensor is

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no blk no lcd
threads.message: Some name that iStat has made up and could be totally incorrect. Could be the digital core temperature, who knows. Just run built in diagnostic to confirm no sensor errors and do not trust a 3rd party application for that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no blk no lcd
